     ÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ¸                                                                   ÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ¸

        In FTL you experience the atmosphere of running a spaceship
        trying to save the galaxy. It's a dangerous mission, with every
        encounter presenting a unique challenge with multiple solutions.
        What will you do if a heavy missile barrage shuts down your
        shields? Reroute all power to the engines in an attempt to
        escape, power up additional weapons to blow your enemy out of the
        sky, or take the fight to them with a boarding party? This
        "spaceship simulation roguelike-like" allows you to take your
        ship and crew on an adventure through a randomly generated galaxy
        filled with glory and bitter defeat.


        ****New Content Available**** 
        The free expansion, FTL: Advanced Edition, is available now!
        Content additions include: new alien race, events, weapons,
        playable ships, drones, and more! Also adds additional musical
        tracks by Ben Prunty, and events by Tom Jubert and guest writer
        Chris Avellone. 

        If you already own FTL it should update the new content
        automatically. Advanced Edition is included free for anyone who
        purchases the game from this point forward. 
        ************************ 


        Key Features:
        Ã‚Â· Complex Strategic Gameplay - Give orders to your crew, manage
          ship power distribution and choose weapon targets in the heat
          of battle. 
        Ã‚Â· Play at Your Own Speed - Pause the game mid-combat to evaluate
          your strategy and give orders. 
        Ã‚Â· Unique Lifeforms and Technology Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Upgrade your ship and unlock
          new ones with the help of six diverse alien races. 
        Ã‚Â· Be the Captain You Want - Hundreds of text based encounters
          will force you to make tough decisions. 
        Ã‚Â· Randomized Galaxy - Each play-through will feature different
          enemies, events, and results to your decisions. No two
          play-throughs will be quite the same. 
        Ã‚Â· No Second Chances! - Permadeath means when you die, there's no
          coming back. The constant threat of defeat adds importance and
          tension to every action.


        Minimum PC System Requirements:
        Ã‚Â· OS: Windows XP / Vista / 7 
        Ã‚Â· Processor: 2 GHz 
        Ã‚Â· Memory: 1 GB RAM 
        Ã‚Â· Graphics: 1280x720 minimum resolution, OpenGL 2.0 Support, and
          recommended dedicated graphics card with 128 MB of RAM 
        Ã‚Â· Hard Drive: 175 MB HD space 
        Ã‚Â· Some integrated Intel HD graphics cards have been known to work
          but are not officially supported. 


        Whats New In v1.5.10:

        This is the first patch for FTL: Advanced Edition. Its focus has
        been on critical issues, and on some small mistakes that were
        easily remedied. It is currently live on Steam, and will make it
        to other venders within a few days. 

        We're still working on some critical iPad issues before
        submitting these fixes to Apple, so there will be a delay for
        getting it on iPads.

        Critical Fixes:
        Ã‚Â· Mac OS X version 10.5.8 is supported once again
        Ã‚Â· Fixed crash when purchasing Clonebay when player had a Zoltan
          in their Medbay
        Ã‚Â· Fixed possible crash and slowdowns when the Backup Battery took
          damage
        Ã‚Â· Fixed crash when loading a save from after the Flagship
          Construction battle 
        Ã‚Â· Fixed possible crash and slowdowns when the Backup Battery took
          damage
        Ã‚Â· Added crash protection for mind controlling in Flagship
          artillery rooms that are full

        General Fixes
        Ã‚Â· Zoltan Cruiser unlock quest fixed
        Ã‚Â· Fixed one cause of incorrectly saving an event, resulting in
          loading a different result
        Ã‚Â· Fixed: Couldn't counter mind control on your crew if enemy ship
          had an Energy Shield
        Ã‚Â· Fixed: Enemy crew in isolated rooms (Flagship Artillery) could
          not damage player crew
        Ã‚Â· Fixed: Advance Edition Stores never stocked a Clonebay if
          player was capped on systems
        Ã‚Â· Fixed: Non-AE FTL Stores would have excess, empty system spaces
          & warn of the sys. cap
        Ã‚Â· Fixed: Quitting mid-jump would create an unreliable save file
        Ã‚Â· Fixed: Hard Mode would generate unbeatable Final Stand sectors
        Ã‚Â· Possible Fix: Infinite Mind Control should no longer happen
        Ã‚Â· Possible Fix: Hacking not draining shields should no longer
          happen
        Ã‚Â· Kestrel's Full Arsenal Achievement fixed
        Ã‚Â· Mind controlled enemies count as intruders for computing if a
          beacon is 'safe'
        Ã‚Â· Minor positioning of clonebay/medbay art and blocked spaces
          fixed
        Ã‚Â· Fixed Defense Drone II not shooting at asteroids
        Ã‚Â· Fixed Rock Achievement #2 -- Allows Swarm Missiles now
        Ã‚Â· Fixed art for the Vulcan Chain Laser and Kestrel C's Medbay
        Ã‚Â· Fixed: Closing menus won't also interact with your drones /
          weapons
        Ã‚Â· Fixed pulsar background when dynamic backgrounds is disabled
        Ã‚Â· Minor event/text fixes
        Ã‚Â· Excess logging removed
